alert.note: Alert for Southern Seward Peninsula Coast (Alaska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Winter Storm Warning issued January 11 at 12:52PM AKST until January 12 at 9:00PM AKST by NWS Fairbanks
info.description: ...WINTER STORM WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL 9 PM AKST FRIDAY... * WHAT...Heavy snow, and periods of blizzard conditions and freezing rain. Additional snow accumulations of 4 to 10 inches and ice accumulations of a light glaze. Winds gusting as high as 55 mph. * WHERE...Southern Seward Peninsula Coast. * WHEN...Until 9 PM AKST Friday. * IMPACTS...Travel could be very difficult to impossible. Areas of blowing snow could significantly reduce visibility. Large snow drifts will form. Ice will cover many surfaces. Power outages are possible. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Heavy snow and blizzard conditions will continue through Friday morning. Freezing rain is possible through tonight.
info.instruction: A Winter Storm Warning for snow means severe winter weather conditions are expected or occurring. This will make travel very difficult or impossible.
